title: Grocery Haul Alert
body: Do you REALLY need four bags of chips and a carton of ice cream? No. Put it back.

title: Your Shopping Cart Is a Mess
body: That cart is a monument to consumerism. Do better for the planet, and for your waistline.

title: Bulk Buying, Seriously?
body: Oh, you're getting the family-sized cereal. Is your 'family' just you on the couch?

title: Another Plastic Bag?
body: I can SEE you have reusable bags in your car. Stop being lazy and save the turtles.

title: Healthy Choices, Please
body: That's not produce; it's a bunch of processed junk. Iâ€™m judging you for your lack of self-control.

title: Is That On Sale?
body: Just because it's on special doesn't mean you need it. You're falling for a marketing trap.

title: Impulse Buy Warning
body: That chocolate bar at the checkout is a test. You are failing miserably.

title: Frozen Food Aisle
body: Real food comes from the ground, not a freezer. Did your mother not teach you how to cook?

title: Look at Your Basket
body: That basket is a disgrace. Think about where all that unnecessary stuff will end up: the landfill.

title: Expensive Water Bottle
body: Why are you buying a $5 imported water bottle? Tap water is FREE. Wake up, sheeple.

title: Are You a Hoarder?
body: Your cart looks like you're preparing for the apocalypse. Stop hoarding things you don't need.

title: Don't Be a Food Waster
body: You're buying more food than you can possibly eat before it expires. That's a sin.

title: Check Your Labels!
body: Can you even pronounce the ingredients on that snack? I bet you can't.

title: Shopping for One?
body: That family-sized pizza for one is a cry for help. I'm just saying.

title: The Self-Checkout Is Judging You
body: The machine knows you're buying too much junk. We all do.

title: More Stuff, More Problems
body: The less you buy, the less you have to clean. It's a simple life hack you clearly haven't learned.

title: Put Down That Soda
body: Do you even know how much sugar is in that drink? It's literally poison.

title: You Don't Need All That
body: Take a look around. Everyone else is buying normal things. What's wrong with you?

title: What Would Your Mom Say?
body: Your mother would be so disappointed with the junk food in your cart.

title: Another Shopping Trip?
body: You were just here yesterday. Do you not have anything better to do with your life?

title: So Trendy, So Wasteful
body: You're paying ten times the price for 'artisanal' carrots. It's just a root vegetable.

title: Is That Ethical?
body: That expensive, handcrafted soap comes in a fancy paper bag. How much waste did it take to make that?

title: Stop Gentrifying the Market
body: Don't ruin this place with your fancy tote bags and your organic kombucha.

title: Look at Me, I Shop Local
body: Shopping 'local' is just an excuse to overspend on things you don't need.

title: Is That a $20 Loaf of Bread?
body: A fool and their money are soon parted. Enjoy your overpriced carbs.

title: Don't Block the Aisle
body: You and your friends are blocking the path with your endless chatter. Some of us have things to do.

title: The Organic" Lie"
body: Do you really think that 'organic' kale is worth the price? It's a marketing scam.

title: You Call This a Bargain?
body: You're bragging about getting a 'deal' on a $50 spice jar. That's not a deal.

title: Are You a Tourist?
body: I can tell you're not from around here. You're taking pictures of vegetables, for goodness sake.

title: More Is Not Better
body: Stop sampling everything. Just buy the cheese and get out of the way.

title: The Pomegranate Problem
body: You don't know how to eat that, do you? Just put it down and walk away.

title: Don't Be So Picky
body: You're squeezing every tomato. Just pick one and move on. You're ruining them for everyone else.

title: That Reusable Bag Has Holes
body: I can see the crumbs coming out of your tote bag. That's not hygienic.

title: Is Your Life a Social Media Post?
body: You're just here to take photos for your Instagram, aren't you? It's pathetic.

title: The Juice is Not Worth the Squeeze
body: You're spending an hour picking out produce. It's not a religious pilgrimage.

title: Put Down the Phone
body: The farmers' market is about community, not swiping through your phone.

title: The 'Karen' of Markets
body: Oh, you're the type to complain that the free-range eggs aren't free-ranging enough.

title: Is Your 'Artisan' Baguette Even Good?
body: You're paying for the story, not the flavor. I can tell.

title: Buying Flowers You'll Let Die
body: You're buying those flowers just to let them wilt in a vase. It's a waste of life.

title: Are You Getting Lost?
body: You've walked past the same stall three times. Just buy something or leave.

title: Another Drill?
body: You already have a drill at home. You just want the new one with the bigger battery, don't you?

title: DIY Disaster in Progress
body: That new saw is not going to make you a better carpenter. It's just going to sit in your garage.

title: Bunnings Is Not a Playground
body: You're letting your kids run wild. This is a hardware store, not a daycare center.

title: What Is That for?
body: You don't even know what that tool does. You're just buying it because it looks cool.

title: Don't Start a Project You Won't Finish
body: That's a lot of lumber for a bookshelf you'll never actually build.

title: Stop Looking, Start Working
body: You're just here to browse, aren't you? Go home and finish your project from last year.

title: The 'Karen' of Power Tools
body: Oh, you're the one who needs the manager because the 'limited edition' hammer isn't limited enough.

title: Your Shed Is Full of Junk
body: That new lawnmower is just going to join the graveyard of forgotten tools in your shed.

title: Are You an Electrician?
body: That new multimeter is not going to magically make you one. Leave it to the professionals.

title: Stop Wasting Paint
body: You don't need five different shades of white. You're just wasting money and resources.

title: Another Unfinished Project?
body: That new workbench is just going to be another flat surface for you to put more junk on.

title: Put Down That Expensive Tool
body: You're not even a professional. That expensive tool is wasted on you.

title: You Don't Need It
body: That's a lot of screws for a project you don't have. Put them back.

title: Why Are You So Loud?
body: Stop talking so loudly on your phone. Some of us are trying to shop.

title: Return That, You Won't Use It
body: You know you're just going to return that in a week, right?

title: Is Your Life Just Projects?
body: It seems like you have a new project every weekend. Just relax and enjoy your life.

title: The 'DIY' Lie
body: You're not doing it yourself. You're just buying all the parts and paying someone else to assemble them.

title: The 'Karen' of Home Improvement
body: You're the type of person to complain that the lumber isn't straight enough for your 'masterpiece'.

title: Your Cart is a Disaster
body: That cart is overflowing with things you don't need. Stop hoarding.

title: More Stuff, More Problems
body: Every new item you buy is another thing you have to find a place for in your cluttered home.

title: McD sounds delicious? No!
body: DON'T EAT TOO MUCH FAST FOOD. IT'LL KILL YOU!!!!! Or, you want to die, then it's up to you.

title: Your Burger is a Time Bomb
body: That burger is full of saturated fat and chemicals. It's literally a time bomb for your health.

title: Another Soda?
body: You're just drinking liquid sugar. It's disgusting and unhealthy.

title: Why Are You in a Drive-Thru?
body: You're sitting in a car to get food you'll eat in a car. Get out and walk somewhere.

title: Don't Bring Your Kids Here
body: You're setting a terrible example for your children by feeding them this garbage.

title: You Call This a Meal?
body: A bag of fried potatoes is not a meal. It's a tragedy.

title: I See You, Fast Food Addict
body: I can see the regret in your eyes. It's not too late to turn back.

title: Stop Wasting Your Money
body: You're spending your hard-earned cash on food that will make you sick. Is it worth it?

title: That's Not Real Food
body: This isn't a kitchen. It's a science lab for creating addictive, unhealthy 'food'.

title: The 'Karen' of Fast Food
body: Oh, you're the one who asks for no pickles and then complains about the lettuce.

title: Your Body Is a Temple
body: Your body is a temple, and you're treating it like a garbage dump.

title: What a Disgrace
body: You're sitting there eating this junk. It's a disgrace to healthy living.

title: Don't Do It
body: Put down that greasy burger. It's not going to make you happy.

title: Are You a Real Human?
body: You're eating a meal that's been made in two minutes. How is that even possible?

title: You'll Regret This Later
body: You'll feel guilty about this meal later. Don't do it to yourself.

title: Think About Your Heart
body: Every bite of that is another step closer to a heart attack.

title: Fast Food Is a Scam
body: They're selling you cheap calories and pretending it's a real meal. Don't fall for it.

title: Don't Be a Sheep
body: Everyone is eating this garbage. Don't be a sheep. Be better.

title: Another Drive-Thru?
body: You were just here yesterday. Are you addicted?

title: This is Not a Treat
body: This isn't a treat. This is a punishment for your body.

title: Don't Buy That, It's Ugly
body: That fast fashion shirt is going to fall apart in one wash. Put it back.

title: You Can't Afford That
body: I can see you looking at the price tag. You can't afford that, and you know it.

title: Stop, You're Not an Influencer
body: You're taking pictures of clothes you can't afford. Stop pretending.

title: The 'Karen' of Shopping
body: Oh, you're the one who needs to 'speak to a manager' because the sale price isn't low enough.

title: More Debt, More Problems
body: Every item you buy is just another step toward debt. Think about your financial future.

title: Do You Need More Shoes?
body: You have ten pairs of shoes at home. Put those back. You're a hoarder.

title: Your 'Style' is a Trend
body: That trendy outfit will be out of style next month. You're wasting your money.

title: Shopping is Not a Hobby
body: You're spending all your free time here. Get a real hobby.

title: You're Not a Celebrity
body: You're trying on clothes you saw a celebrity wear. You're not a celebrity.

title: Look at All That Waste
body: That bag, that tissue paper, that box... it's all just going to end up in the trash.

title: Impulse Buying is a Sickness
body: Your impulse to buy is a sickness. Seek help.

title: The 'Karen' of Retail
body: You're the type to demand a discount because you're a 'loyal customer'.

title: You Don't Need That Mug
body: You have a dozen mugs at home. You don't need another one.

title: Think About the Environment
body: That fast fashion company uses unethical labor and pollutes the environment. Stop supporting them.

title: You're Getting Ripped Off
body: That item is available online for half the price. You're getting ripped off.

title: Stop Wasting Your Money
body: You're spending your money on things you'll regret. Put your wallet away.

title: Just Looking? Yeah Right.
body: You say you're 'just looking,' but we both know you're going to buy something you don't need.

title: Another Unnecessary Purchase
body: That's just another piece of useless junk to clutter your home.

title: Your Life is Not a Magazine
body: You're trying to replicate a magazine cover with your purchases. Get a grip.

title: Go Home and Be Productive
body: Stop wasting your day here. Go home and do something productive.
